# go list should not report SWIG-generated C++ files in CompiledGoFiles.

[!exec:swig] skip
[!exec:g++] skip
[!cgo] skip
# NOTE(happygo): This test is not run on Windows upstream because swig
# is not installed on LUCI Windows builders. On GHA Windows, swig is
# available but the test fails because $GOCACHE backslashes are
# interpreted as regex escapes in the stdout pattern match.
[GOOS:windows] skip 'swig not tested on Windows upstream; path handling issues on GHA'

# CompiledGoFiles should contain 4 files:
#  a.go
#  _cgo_import.go [gc only]
#  _cgo_gotypes.go
#  a.cgo1.go
#
# These names we see here, other than a.go, will be from the build cache,
# so we just count them.

go list -f '{{.CompiledGoFiles}}' -compiled=true example/swig

stdout a\.go
[compiler:gc] stdout -count=3 $GOCACHE
[compiler:gccgo] stdout -count=2 $GOCACHE

-- go.mod --
module example

go 1.16

-- swig/a.go --
package swig

-- swig/a.swigcxx --
